beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads input from a file (trade_ids.txt) * converts input into a map * uses a file based enrichment processor to enrich the input data with data from trades.txt * the enrichment processor uses a custom file read connector that implements a simple search-by-id mechanism * converts the resulting orderedmap to xml * writes to stdout
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of a file based enrichment processor.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config enrich-processor.xml
Node that this example uses a custom file reader (CustomFileReadConnector.java), located in this folder.
You need the following in your classpath (note the extra read connector):
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar CustomFileReadConnector.class
Once the adaptor is running you should see several records echo-ed in XML:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <record><TradeId>1</TradeId><BuyOrSell>'B'</BuyOrSell><Price>3.25</Price><Quantity>1000000</Quantity></record> ...
